title: Keep Disconnecting from PvP Client
body: Only today I would get a red message stating that I have dc from the PvP client then would reconnect seconds later. This would repeat endlessly although I am still able to play games fine. I have wired connection and my internet is perfect atm. Seems like a client or a server problem. I also can't see my full friend list.

replies.body:
Hey everyone,

I can confirm that we do seem to be seeing something funny (and not "ha-ha" funny) across all regions since we deployed 5.8.  Right now we're assessing the magnitude of the issue and exploring potential root causes.  We'll update as soon as we can.  Please hang in there.

From our understanding, it appears that the issue:
-Began happening after the 5.8 deploy
-Is not specific to one ISP
-Does not prevent players from playing games, unless it happens during champ select
-Is happening to some players, but not all players
-Is definitely a pain in the ass
-Is not likely related to any client crashing issues, but we haven't ruled that out yet

Any trends that I'm missing?
If you disable IP helper, it works fine. Worth looking at.

I can confirm that. Same happened to me, steady pvp.net DCs sind patch 5.8. Disabling IP-Helper fixed this issue.
To disable IP-Helper, press windows+r, execute, type in "services.msc" hit enter. In services, look for "IP-Helper", right click, then disable it. Also set start value of it to "deactivated".

I had to disable IPv6 on my adapter. IP Helper service isn't on my windows installation for whatever reason. So far, so good. Beware if anything you use relies on the IPv6 protocol (Homegroup, Remote Assistance, idk), but if you've disabled IP Helper then you've already crossed the bridge i think :p

****
Control Panel -> Network and Internet -> Network Connections
Right click your network connection (ie: Wireless Network Connection x)
Select properties
Uncheck "Internet Protocol Version 6 (TCP/IPv6)
****
Codewise, This is definitely an windows sockets issue (winsock2.h/Wstcpip.h).  My best guess is a portability issue with IPv6 across windows platforms/versions... If there's a possibility that it's on Riot's end, check if there's any modifications or problems with code that calls winsock2 (Ws2_32.lib) functions or maybe setup a debug scenario that can try to catch why it's closing the socket.  Not trying to sound condescending towards the programmers, I've personally gone through the hell of troubleshooting windows sockets myself and just throwing the ideas out there to spark the imagination :p

It could also have something to do with outdated drivers on the user's end... I'm not sure if Microsoft has made significant changes to the IPv4 -> IPv6 libraries in x amount of years (or since the problem started being reported). I haven't updated windows in like 3 years, sooo.

Good luck to everyone, I hope this information helps someone. {{summoner:13}}

I had tried disabling the IPHelper service as mentioned, but I had no luck so I continued to poke around and found that some of my VPN software was interfering so I disabled their connections. I also noticed someone pointed out in this thread said that disabling Hamachi worked for them. It's important to note, at least for me,  simply "Exiting" Hamachi didn't help my situation.

I'll just lay out what I did, in the case that someone had the same difficulties I did and so that non-tech savvy people (such as myself) can easily follow.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1.Start Button > Run > type in "services.msc" > Enter
2. Scroll to "LogMeIn Hamachi Tunneling Engine" > Right Click > 
Hit "Stop"

If problem still persists...:

3. Start Button > Control Panel > Network and Internet > Network and Sharing Center > "Change adapter settings" (located on the left)
4. Find "Hamachi" or something similarly named
5. Right Click "Hamachi" > Disable
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Really hope it helps someone! I know how frustrating it was trying to queue up with friends only to have to tell them "Wait, wait, I disconnected. I'm not actually in queue anymore. Re-invite please." {{champion:32}}


EDIT: I'm not sure if the problem was isolated to only Hamachi or if other VPNs negatively impacted it too, but the process would remain similar I assume for other programs.
